@tyschalter @Duffyd87 @fbgchase And causes all kinds of issues, cos now people think compare = equate.
@tyschalter @Duffyd87 @fbgchase Don't think that's just a US thing, but it's an odd phrase, since compare seems to cover it.
@Duffyd87 @fbgchase @tyschalter Somewhere along the line people forgot the second part.
@Duffyd87 @fbgchase @tyschalter No, this is the point. Definition of compare https://t.co/GDJgvy4F2x 'similarities AND differences'

@Duffyd87 @fbgchase @tyschalter Comparing doesn't mean the things must be similar. It's a positive or negative conclusion exercise.
